metadata.title: CVE-2013-2015 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ext4_orphan_del function in fs/ext4/namei.c in the Linux kernel before3.7.3 does not properly handle orphan-list entries for non-journalfilesystems, which allows physically proximate attackers to cause a denialof service (system hang) via a crafted filesystem on removable media, asdemonstrated by the e2fsprogs tests/f_orphan_extents_inode/image.gz test.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

linux-image-extra-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
